rows.scenario_title: Boyfriend pressures @global.w_svp_teen_girl_1 to go beyond kissing

scenario_title.eng: Boyfriend pressures @global.w_svp_teen_girl_1 to go beyond kissing

scenario_text.eng:
@global.w_svp_teen_girl_1: "I don't think I am ready..."

Boyfriend: "Oh come on... We are ready for the next step. We see each other all the time and we never do anything more… You know I love you, right!"

question_text.eng:
What warning signs do you see here?

The boyfriend:

option_1.eng: Does not listen to @global.w_svp_teen_girl_1 or ask what she wants

option_3.eng: Makes @global.w_svp_teen_girl_1 feel bad about how she acts

reply_all.eng:
Yes, these are clear warning signs! Your partner (or anyone else) should never try to push or convince you to do something you do not want to do or feel unsure about. Even if you do something once, this does not mean you have to do it again – you are allowed to change your mind at any time, even during an intimate moment.

A partner who really loves and respects you will ask if you are okay, listen to you, and stop if you want to. They would never push you into something you do not want to do.

scenario_text.eng:
@global.w_svp_teen_girl_1: “I just wanted to…”

Boyfriend: “No, you are staying here. You always leave me alone to go see your friends. Don’t you love me? Or are you meeting your other boyfriend?!”

question_text.eng:
What warning signs do you see here?

The boyfriend:

option_4.eng: Makes @global.w_svp_teen_girl_1 feel bad about how she act

reply_all.eng:
Yes, all of these are warning signs! When we are in love, it can be hard to recognise something is wrong in our relationship. 

If you have a friend in @global.w_svp_teen_girl_1’s situation, try to help them see that jealous, possessive or controlling behaviour is not healthy or loving.

rows.scenario_title: @global.w_svp_teen_boy_1’s friend shouts sexual comment at girl

scenario_title.eng: @global.w_svp_teen_boy_1’s friend shouts sexual comment at girl

scenario_text.eng: Friend: “Hey pretty, why are you walking so fast! Don’t you want to come show us what is under that skirt?”

question_text.eng:
What warning signs do you see here?

The friend:

option_2.eng: Makes the girl feel uncomfortable about how she looks and acts

reply_all.eng:
Yes, all of these are warning signs! Shouting sexual comments, whistling or making kissing sounds at someone is sexual harassment and a type of sexual abuse. 

If @global.w_svp_teen_boy_1 stays silent, his friend will likely keep doing this. @global.w_svp_teen_boy_1 can help his friend see that his behaviour makes girls feel scared, angry, or sad, and is not okay.

question_text.eng: What warning signs do you see here?

option_2.eng: The friend does not listen to @global.w_svp_teen_girl_2.

reply_all.eng:
Yes, all of these are warning signs! It is common for young women to be pressured into sex when men offer food, gifts, or money. 

Whenever you do not get the space to make your own decisions, that can be dangerous. Your friends, and others, should respect your choices.

rows.scenario_title: Teacher asks @global.w_svp_teen_girl_1 to stay after school

scenario_title.eng: Teacher asks @global.w_svp_teen_girl_1 to stay after school

question_text.eng:
What warning signs do you see here?

The teacher:

reply_all.eng:
Yes, all of these are warning signs! Schools have strict rules to keep students safe. The teacher is abusing his power and knows that what he is doing is wrong. 

Probably, he has tried this before and will do it again, so @global.w_svp_teen_girl_1 could try to find others with the same experience to make it easier to report the teacher to an adult who she trusts.

scenario_text.eng:
@global.w_svp_teen_girl_2: “No, I don’t want to…”

Man: “Your friends left, so this is the only way you can get home, you idiot!”

question_text.eng:
What warning signs do you see here?

The man:

reply_all.eng:
Yes, all of these are warning signs! Your ‘no’ should alway be respected. 

Also remember, if people at home or outside use alcohol and other drugs this can be a warning sign, as those can make people angry, aggressive, and even violent.
